For the years ended December 31, 2024 and 2023 we generated 83% and 88%, respectively, of total revenue in the U.S. No other country accounted for more than 10% of revenue . International revenue comprised mainly transaction revenue in both years presented . Prior period amounts were reclassified to conform to current period presentation .
 The percentage of transaction revenue from trading on our platform broken down by crypto asset was as follows: Bitcoin, Etherum, Bitcoin and other crypto assets . No other crypto asset individually represented more than 10% of the total . Subscription and services revenue increased for the year ended December 31, 2024 as compared to 2023, due to an increase in stablecoin revenue .
 Certain prior period amounts have been reclassified to conform to current period presentation . The Company reported a $350.5 million increase in rewards, interest and finance fee income, primarily driven by higher average crypto asset prices, mainly Bitcoin, Solana, and Etherum, and Bitcoin . The company's operating expenses were increased by $1.2 million to $2.3 million .
 Transaction expense increased for the year ended December 31, 2024 as compared to 2023, due to: higher blockchain rewards fees, which rose generally in line with blockchain rewards revenue . There were no material changes to note within transaction reversal losses, blockchain transaction fees, or other expenses . Transaction expenses as a percentage of total revenue will vary depending on the composition of the Company’s total revenue .
 There was no change in overall transaction expense as a percentage of total revenue when comparing the periods presented . Technology and development expenses increased for the year ended December 31, 2024 as compared to 2023 . There were no material changes to note within amortization, depreciation, and impairment or other.commodest expenses driven by increased activity on our platform .
 An increase in marketing programs expenses was primarily due to $75.4 million higher digital advertising spend, and an increase in customer referral and other promotional initiatives . The company also increased USDC rewards payouts of $112.4 million due to higher reward rates offered to customers in an effort to enhance customer acquisition, retention, and platform engagement .
 The remaining variance in other was due to increases across various expenses, with no material changes to note .  $33.3 million in policy spend as we increased our crypto advocacy efforts;  $31.0 million in taxes, licenses, and fees primarily due to higher indirect taxes associated with the growth in revenue and the application of certain indirect tax rules .
 ucturing expense was $142.6 million for the year ended December 31, 2023, comprising separation pay, stock-based compensation expense, and other personnel costs related to the workforce reduction in January 2023 . There were no restructuring expenses for the  year ended Dec. 31, 2024 . Interest and other expenses were primarily due to remeasurement of the fair value of crypto assets held for investment, net .
 For the year ended December 31, 2024 as compared to 2023, the increase in provision for income taxes was primarily due to higher pretax income, partially offset by tax benefits from stock-based compensation . The Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development introduced Pillar Two model rules imposing a 15% global minimum tax on companies such as ours .
 Adjusted EBITDA provides additional company-specific adjustments for certain items that may be included in income from operations but that we do not consider to be normal, recurring, operating expenses necessary to operate our business . The amounts of such expenses can vary significantly from period to period and may not directly correlate to the underlying performance of our business operations .
 We believe Adjusted EBITDA is useful to measure a company’s operating performance without regard to items such as stock-based compensation expense, depreciation and amortization expense, interest expense, other (income) expense, net, restructurings, and benefit from or provision for income taxes that can vary substantially from company to company depending upon financing, capital structures, and the method by which assets were acquired .

We primarily receive crypto assets held for operations as payments for transaction revenue, blockchain rewards, custodial fee revenue, and other subscriptions and services revenue . We may not be able to sell our crypto assets at reasonable prices or at all .
 We borrow crypto assets from eligible institutional customers . These borrowings generally have open-ended terms or have a term of less than one year . We were in compliance with all collateral requirements as of December 31, 2024 . We also hold additional customer Assets on Platform that we do not recognize in our Consolidated Balance Sheets .
 We do not use customer crypto assets as collateral for any loan, margin, rehypothecation, or other similar activities to which we or our affiliates are a party, without the customer’s consent . Our business model does not expose us to liquidity risk if we have excessive redemptions or withdrawals from customers .
